page.title: 08WOMEN'S GUILD RALLY
page.content: For an island of just over 300 people the arrival of another 300 is quite an {event. This happened on the{6th of June 1985. The occasion was the annual Rally of the{Women's Guild}in Orkney.Usually this takes place on the mainland of Orkney.For the first time the Rally was being held in{Shapinsay.}For weeks in advance,the ladies of the Guild were making plans.Everyone who had a car was persuaded to chauffeur from the pier to the church.The car park was chock-a-block.The guests arrived on the Orcadia.In almost every kitchen there was a taste bud tingling aroma of freshly baked buns,sponges and bere bannocks.In addition mountains of sandwiches were provided.That afternoon the{church}was decorated with garden flowers of many kinds. The evening was a huge success.
